CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C02

TI_TEXT.P: Услуги по управление на инсталации в жилищните сгради

TITLE.P: Facilities Management Services (Soft FM) for Orbis Services

SHORT_DESCR.P: East Sussex County Council (ESCC), on behalf of itself, Surrey County Council (SCC) and Brighton & Hove City Council (BHCC), is seeking applications from suitably qualified and interested organisations to provide range of facilities management services. The services required are as follows:

Orbis is a public sector partnership between Surrey County Council (SCC), East Sussex County Council (ESCC), and Brighton & Hove City Council (BHCC). The business services functions of Orbis provide a range of professional, advisory, transactional and operational services including Property, which support residents, elected councillors, and public-facing services.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: All lots, individual lots or any combination of lots.

TITLE.P: Grounds Maintenance Services and Arboricultural Services — East Sussex County Council

SHORT_DESCR.P: Grounds Maintenance Services and Arboriculture Services in East Sussex (see complimentary information Section VI) for full scope of services for the Lots.

The High End Values are given as a guide only to allow for additional schools and customers who do not access the current arrangements but who may be offered the opportunity when these arrangements are in place. Where BHCC are included as a potential contracting authority under the Lot the annual value has been included in the High End Value. Lower limits are a guide only based on current uptake from corporate assets, schools and other customers who currently access the arrangements. Customers outside of the Councils corporate estate are allowed to review their continuing use of these contracts on an annual basis and as such the Low End Value is not a guarantee of volume or value under this arrangement.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Upon expiry of initial term or initial term plus extensions. Details of the exact start date and end date for these lots is provided in the procurement documents.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As detailed in the procurement documents. The Council will seek to invite a minimum of 5 organisations (subject to interest) and a maximum of 7 organisations for each lot to receive the ITT. In the event that there are less than 5 suitably qualified Suppliers, the Authority may take through the number (less than 5) of suitably qualified Suppliers, provided that there is a sufficient number of Suppliers to ensure a genuine competition.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Initial term to 31.3.2022. Options available for up to 2 further years until 31.3.2024.

INFO_ADD.P: Brighton & Hove City Council are also included as a potential contracting authority under this Lot, and have the option to enter into a contract with the successful provider under the same terms and conditions and specification either at the point of award or during the contract term.

SUITABILITY.P: As detailed in the Procurement Documents, Selection Questionnaire and/or Invitation to Tender.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: As detailed in the Procurement Documents, Selection Questionnaire and/or Invitation to Tender.

ESTIMATED_TIMING.P: Approx. 12 months prior to end date.

INFO_ADD.P: All procurement documents are available, and must be completed electronically, using the SE Shared Services Procurement eSourcing portal.

The SE Shared Services eSourcing portal provides a web-based tool that provides a simple, secure and efficient means for managing tendering and quotation activities reducing the time and effort required for both buyers and Potential Bidders. The portal allows for tender clarifications and submitting your bid electronically. In order to bid for this opportunity you will need to register your company on the SE Shared Services portal. Orbis Property Services manages a number of assets and customers on behalf of the Partner Councils providing access to a range of services, these services form part of this service offer. These assets and customers are further defined in the Procurement Documents.

The requirements and services detailed within these Lots will cover all corporate and non-corporate buildings and assets within the Councils responsibility. The services will also be open to all Schools (maintained, academies, specialist schools and free schools) within the respective geographic boundaries of each Contracting Authority as well as East Sussex Fire & Rescue Service and Surrey Fire & Rescue Services. These services will be provided from the successful Service Providers via a Service Level Agreement, as such they are not separate Contracting Authorities. These services may be requested at any point during the contract term. However no guarantee can be given as to the number of customers who will place an order under this contract, or when, as some of these will have existing arrangements in place.
Details of all Maintained Schools, Academies and Free Schools and Fire Services are:
East Sussex Fire and Rescue Service: https://www.esfrs.org/#
Change of original deadline for receipts of applications from 202.2018 at 13.00 pm to 232.2018 at 14.00 pm.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: East Sussex County Council will incorporate a minimum of 10 calendar days standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. This period allows unsuccessful tenderers to seek further debriefing from the Contracting Authority or the lodging of an appeal before the contract is entered into. Such additional information should be requested from the contact point referenced in Part 1.1) of the Contract Notice.
